name: European Network of Fibromyalgia Associations
memberOrga: ENFA's membership consists of national and/or regional organisations for people with fibromyalgia and/or other pain/musculoskeletal conditions. A current list of member organisations can be found on the ENFA website: https://www.enfa-europe.eu/members/
goal: The European Network of Fibromyalgia Associations (ENFA) champions increased awareness, research and support for people living with fibromyalgia across Europe.
interests: Communication, Consumers, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Public Health, Youth
euInitiatives: The European Network of Fibromyalgia Associations (ENFA) unites national organisations working in the field of fibromyalgia, as well as other umbrella organisations across Europe, to raise awareness, campaign for change, and advocate for research. ENFA was formally established on 16 October 2008, and has long worked to see the written declaration 69/2008 implemented by the European institutions and national governments. ENFA are keen to see fibromyalgia recognised as a key topic for prioritisation, given that the disease affects an estimated 14 million people in Europe.
